thread.title: Claudio Ranieri takes grandson to the zoo in Italy… as Leicester prepare for crucial Premier League showdown with Liverpool
thread.title_full: Claudio Ranieri takes grandson to the zoo in Italy… as Leicester prepare for crucial Premier League showdown with Liverpool

author: smorgan
title: Claudio Ranieri takes grandson to the zoo in Italy… as Leicester prepare for crucial Premier League showdown with Liverpool
text:
EFL Grand day out Claudio Ranieri takes grandson to the zoo in Italy… as Leicester prepare for crucial Premier League showdown with Liverpool 
Former Foxes boss' dismissal stunned football and he's trying since returned home to his family. Pictured Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments CLAUDIO RANIERI looks to get over his shocking Leicester sacking by enjoying a family day out at the zoo. 
The former Foxes boss’ dismissal less than 12 months after guiding them to the Premier League title stunned football. MEGA Claudio Ranieri was seen enjoying some time at the zoo with his grandson MEGA 5 The former Leicester manager looked to get over the pain of his shock dismissal by going on a family outing 
But he cut an upbeat figure on a family outing with daughter Claudia, while Leicester players prepared for their crunch clash against Liverpool. 
Doting granddad Claudio picked up his grandchild and held its hand as they walked round the Bioparco zoo in Rome. 
And the sun shone on their trip as the ex-King Power chief now contemplates life away from the English top flight. MEGA 5 Claudio Ranieri looked delighted to be spending time with his grandchild 
Ranieri did not look to be approached by fans during the outing – a far cry from the standing ovation he received after he said goodbye to one of his favourite Leicester restaurants. 
Meanwhile, Marc Albrighton has slammed reports he was one of the group of players pushing for Ranieri’s exit. 
He said: “This is totally incorrect. I had a good relationship with the manager and total respect for what he achieved for the club. 
“I spoke with him after he left and thanked him personally for everything he did for me.” MEGA Claudio Ranieri was sacked as Leicester manager less than 12 months after leading them to the Premier League title Getty Images Marc Albrighton insists he was nothing to do with the decision to axe Claudio Ranieri Claudio Ranieri Leicester manager: What a difference half a season makes Related stories Everton star Romelu Lukaku will sign a new Goodison Park contract, says agent Mino Raiola Gunner to goner Arsenal lose highly-rated academy chief Andries Jonker as Dutch coach agrees to take Wolfsburg manager’s job GOING, GOING, GONG As Zlatan Ibrahimovic picks up trophy No32, we take a look at the Swede's incredible career travelling Europe and his 31other honours NICE ONE, MY SONS Manchester United fans owe Zlatan Ibrahimovic's two sons a big thank you... as he reveals they convinced him to move to Old Trafford Captain KO Jordan Henderson ruled out of Leicester clash with injury which could also see him miss vital Arsenal shoot-out Spurs ponder Rab raid Spurs could make move for Paris Saint Germain star Adrien Rabiot who hints at exit Nou chance Atletico Madrid president says 'We are trying to sign Lionel Messi' while discussing Fernando Torres' new deal Team news Manchester City vs Huddersfield team news: Pep Guardiola hopes to welcome back Vincent Kompany for FA Cup clash TV Times Manchester City vs Huddersfield: What TV channel is it on, what time is kick-off and what is the team news? free-k results Zlatan Ibrahimovic joined Manchester United for nothing and has hit 26 goals already — but is he the best free signing of all-time? Preview Manchester City vs Huddersfield: What time is kick-off, what TV channel is it on and what is the team news? Jose wants Mour Jose Mourinho wants ‘two or three’ stars in summer spending spree to help Man United take ‘next step’ 
And Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp appeared to back Albrighton's remarks by saying players do not have a direct line to a club's owner. 
He said: "Players are not more powerful. We were much more powerful in the past. It depends always on the board. 
"There is never a direct line to the owner or whatever. As long as the players talk together there is no problem."
